While vessel was under maintenance, deckhand moved to open a window and fell approximately three metres through open hatch. Deckhand incurred a cut to the shin and was taken to hospital for check up.
Rescue vessel returning from training came across an upturned dinghy with two people clinging to it. The vessel rescued the occupants and then returned to recover the dinghy and personal items.
Propeller of boat engine scraped across a bar. Occupants pushed boat into deeper water and then propeller was lowered and the vessel continued on.
Loss of engagement on vessel due to suspected gear box fault so vessel secured safely and shut engines down before being towed back to wharf.
Passenger on chartered fishing trip was injured when a large wave hit the vessel.
Dragon boat took on water and capsized. There were some minor injuries and no damage.
Crane driver on board cargo ship unlatched the side window of the crane when it dislodged from the frame and fell into the hold of the vessel. There were no injuries.
Crew member required a medivac urgently due to a serious medical condition.
Event Location: SE of East Head, Banks Peninsula

Brief Description: Pilot Ladder listing at 45 degree.  Loose chocks.
Departing vessel worked engine up to Half Ahead then noticed the main engine RPM surging. Engineer requested for main engine to be limited to half speed.
Crew member sustained perforated eardrums after diving to a depth of approximately 10m to retrieve an object dropped overboard.
Digger operator smelled smoke whilst stowing logs on ship. Fire was put out with a fire extinguisher and was found to have been caused by friction between a rubber seal and exhaust outlet.
Crew member tripped while carrying a 20 Kg carton. The carton fell on an angle, with the corner striking the top of their finger. X-rays revealed a finger fracture.
Jet boat grounded after driver took wrong turn. There were no injuries or damage.
Yacht ran aground on bar and was towed by Coastguard to safety. Yacht skipper sustained minor injuries.

Barge was being assembled whilst tied to temporary wharf. Team member was seated, welding the base of the edge protection upright with their foot over the edge. As the swell lifted the pontoon their foot became stuck, causing a fracture.
Vessel moored at marina caught fire. Firefighters attempted to extinguish the fire but were unable to prevent it from sinking due to damage to its hull. There were no injuries.
Boatie called for help after vessel became stranded on rocks. Coastguard attended and towed vessel.
Ship's cook injured their elbow while loading supplies onto vessel.
Vessel engine fouled with seaweed. Driver managed to push boat upstream and into deep water. Passengers were transferred to back up boat to complete trip.
Crew member tripped on the lower deck accommodation entryway, sustaining a broken leg.
IRB driver hesitated in the breaking wave zone and then turned on a breaking wave causing the IRB to rollover. There were no injuries or damage.
IRB driver got caught on a shore break which caused the boat to flip towards the shore. There were no injuries or damage.
IRB driver turned to avoid a wave and collided with a lifeguard on a paddleboard. There were no injuries or damage.
Vessel engine fouled after entering area of dense kelp growth. Due to rough weather they called for assistance, with RCCNZ responding.
Pilot ladder was found to have loose chocks and steps, with some of the lower steps rotating underfoot. The construction was also poor with aluminium crimps.

Launch with crew were travelling to fishing event and set anchor for the night. The anchor dragged and vessel grounded on rocks. Crew tried to push if off but it started taking on water. Coastguard was called and vessel was moved to another beach.
During loading of cargo onto bulk carrier, two strands of the crane's hoist wire snapped. Loading was halted immediately. There were no injuries.
Pilot ladder was noted to have multiple loose chocks and steps that rotated underfoot. The master was advised that the ladder needed to be replaced.
Steering arm linkage on a work boat broke on the outboard motor causing loss of steerage. New steering arm was installed before continuing journey.
Work boat attempted to navigate bar 1.5 hours after low tide but still grounded. Boat was reversed out of the bar and then safely crossed into port 1.5 hours later.

Main engine commenced an unplanned slow down whilst the telegraph was set at full ahead. Engine slowed to dead slow ahead RPM for around 5-6 minutes. Full ahead revs slowly regained and the pilotage was completed without further incident.
Rescue vessel went to aid of person who fell out of kayak and unable to refloat kayak. Safely returned to shore with kayak and paddle. No injuries.

Due to stairwell being blocked and man cage not available, Stevedores had to climb ladder to get out of hold. Second climber got to top of ladder when they lost footing and fell 1.8 m onto the deck, sustaining a knee injury.
Trawler lost propulsion when oil pump on gearbox failed. Another vessel was dispatched to assist and pump was replaced with spare. Vessel returned to port with no assistance required.
Vessel was crossing bar when one engine shut down and the other engine presented an alarm. Skipper shut down the vessel, then restarted port engine and finished transit of bar.
Stevedore was walking portside when their leg went through a gap in the walkway, resulting in minor bruising.

Cruise ships thrusters malfunctioned as the ship was coming into port, this caused the ship to approach wharf too fast and the thruster alarm sounded. Tugs were positioned well to assist and crew acted immediately to correct vessel movement.
Near miss with another passenger vessel while coming into berth. Other vessel did not give way as per regulations engine was put into reverse to avoid collision.
Near miss with another passenger vessel while coming into berth. Other vessel did not give way as per regulations engine was put into reverse to avoid collision.
Maritime Radio received a call requesting urgent extraction of a passenger experiencing cardiac arrest. A rescue helicopter flew patient to hospital.

Vessel dragged anchor overnight and made contact with rocks. No one onboard at the time of the accident but vessel sustained a small hole in the chine in aft hold and damage to the duck board rudder and propeller damage.

Vessel departed berth and shortly after experienced a partial loss of power to some of the bridge electronics. Speed was reduced and systems were restarted which resolved the issue. There was no loss or propulsion or steering.
Steering jam due to a small stone getting wedged under the jet nozzle water cantering cone. Passengers transferred to another vessel to resume journey.
While performing a planned turn, jet boat beached in shallow water.  No injuries or damage.  Vessel continued on journey.
IRB driver hit a wave as it was peaking, the boat was then pushed backwards and went underwater, driver and crew fell out. There were no injuries or damage.
Vessel partially grounded on bar, and was refloated without damage or injuries.
Jet boat has minor damage to the stern rub rail after making contact with a rock as vessel passed it. No injuries.

Dredger grounded after a stray line became entangled in the propellers. The skipper immediately turned the engine off and dropped anchor but the anchor dragged, and with no ability to steer the vessel beached.
Jet boat ran aground on river bank. Operator able to push vessel back into river. No injuries, no damage.
Crew member slipped and twisted their knee while working in the hold during unloading.
While moving vessel to a new berth, vessel took longer to stop which resulted in a near miss with another vessel.  No injuries, no damage.
Discharging containers when one container fell approximately one meter.
Hydraulic pipe burst. Oil boom was deployed around vessel as additional precaution. A small amount of oil entered the water.
Recreational yacht ran aground and stranded on rocks.
As pilot boat approached vessel, they were informed that the starboard side ladder had multiple loose chocks. They were notified in time to rig port side ladder as alternative.
Passenger sustained a back injury after vessel shifted heavily while crossing a large wave. Vessel returned to port and ambulance called.
Kayaker rescued from rocks after falling off kayak and kayak taking on water.
Jet boat grounding during planned spin.  Passengers disembarked, vessel was pushed boat back into deeper water and continued on voyage.
Vessel collided with a navigation marker in harbour. Damage to marker and boat. Two passengers injured. Vessel towed back to boat ramp.
Emergency Medevac of seriously ill passenger.

Boat was towing another vessel when it hit a bridge, there was not sufficient head room even though this had been assessed before passing through. The boat's superstructure was damaged. There were no injuries.
Event Location: Outboard Boating Club Bridge, Tamaki Drive

Brief Description: Jetboat cruising up river, hit a sand bar and came to a sudden halt.  One crew member got thrown forward, hitting master on shoulder and then hitting their face and knee against side of vessel.  No medical attention required.
Hired kayak filled with water and was found to have a missing plug. Kayak was pulled into rocks and drained, and then operator arrived with replacement plug.

Fisherman onboard dinghy was knocked overboard by a wave. Fisherman inflated their lifejacket and was clear when the dinghy collided against rocks, damaging its motor. Dinghy was towed to main vessel.
Jet boat ran aground during a planned turn. No damage or injuries and vessel continued voyage.
While travelling under a dam, jetboat overturned and made contact with a rock.  15 passengers transferred to another vessel.  No injuries and minor damage to vessel.
During pre-departure engine room check, crew noticed engine start batteries overheated.  Engine turned off.  PPE gear worn and battery removed and replaced with new battery.  Voyage continued.
During jet boat spin, passenger hit their head on the dashboard and was taken to afterhours medical professional.
Pilot ladder standards - Steps rotated underfoot.
Jet boat grounded during a planned turn in shallow waters.
Recreational launch sunk.
Driver of IRB underestimated the wave height causing the wave to impact the boat, the driver and crew person both lost their grip and fell out. There were no injuries or damage.
IRB hit wave and was pushed sideways and crew person was ejected from the boat, person got back in immediately. There was no injuries or damage.
Participant of waterski race event fell and fractured two back vertebrae.
Collision between two IRBs during a race, the vessels were obscured from each other by the surf. There was no damage and minor bruising.
Collision between two IRBs during a race, the vessels were obscured from each other by the surf. There was no damage and minor bruising.
Snorkeler aspirated some seawater whilst on a commercial diving trip. Crew assisted person back to shore.
Driver of IRB was coming out through surf when the crew person lost their grip and fell overboard.
As crew person placed hand on the bow ladder railing, the ladder opened forwards and the crew member fell overboard into the water.
Container ship lost power to main engine whilst coming in to berth. Two tug boats were used to berth ship.
Three people got onto yacht with no centre board or sails. Yacht started to sink and they were rescued by Coastguard.
Person suffering a medical event was evacuated by helicopter off a fishing charter.
Crew member suffered a stroke whilst on board ship and was transported by ambulance to hospital, they were to be medically evacuated back to their home country after a few days.
Jet boat driver made a late decision to turn down a channel and ended up beaching. There was no damage or injuries.
Charter vessel hit submerged object. The impact destroyed the sounder transducer. There were no injuries.
Event Location: North of Nine Pin Rock, Bay of Islands

Brief Description: Oil tanker's pilot ladder was found to be in sub-standard condition, it was stretched on one side and the retrieval line was rigged incorrectly.
Crew member caught finger in ponar sampling gear, and sustained a fractured finger.
Jet boat driver was attempting a planned turn when the vessel grounded. There were no injuries or damage.
Wave smashed in window on fishing vessel, crew checked vessel and travelled to port once weather subsided. There were no injuries.
Fatal medical event during a commercial operation.
Passenger on fishing charter fell back and hit their head.

Crew member was walking backwards down the gangway with the fuel hose and accidentally fell through the gap between the vessel and the gangway. Crew member was helped up and driven to medical centre and was assessed a with minor head injury.
Skipper misjudged the current when entering river and the vessel was swept towards a pile. Vessel made contact with the pile. There were no injuries and minor paint damage to the pile and vessel.
500 litres of oil was spilled onto ferry during refuelling, most of the spill was contained onboard.
Jet boat crashed on a Waita river. Two people were injured and attended to by ambulance service.
Pilot ladder was found to have multiple loose chocks, once on board pilot vessel the pilot advised the ship the ladder was not to be used again.
During a training session the vessel picked up someone out of the water, and then capsized on the next wave due to failure to turn. There were no injuries or damage.
Fatal accident during a commercial operation.
Skipper of vessel observed travelling past other vessels at high speed and in close proximity.
Rescue vessel attended a sinking boat and rescued the occupants, the rescue vessel advised they exceeded the speed limit briefly whilst making their way to the vessel in distress.
Rescue vessel attended a sinking boat and rescued the occupants, the rescue vessel advised they exceeded the speed limit briefly whilst making their way to the vessel in distress.
Skipper became disorientated and struck rock at the end of a reef. Skipper made their way back to port unassisted.
Event Location: Reef off Wallaby Creek, Abel Tasman National Park

Brief Description: IRB engine cut out in surf, driver attempted to restart but it cut out again. A wave then capsized the boat. There were no injuries or damage.
During the arrival of a bulk carrier, a kayak tried to cross its path. The ship sounded its horn and the kayak retreated.
Engine stopped on fishing launch, and power was lost to the reverse gear throttle. The boat then drifted into the concrete jetty pylon. There was no damage or injuries.
Whilst disembarking, pilot found ladder to be in poor condition with loose chocks. Ladder was also rigged on an angle and had no man ropes.
Container ship on approach to NZ advised that one of their generators was non operational. The remaining three generators were all fully functioning.
Engine in jet boat failed and the cause was later found to be a broken crank. A replacement boat pulled alongside and passengers transferred across without incident.
Tanker on approach to NZ advised their vessel had a bridge navigation watch alarm system failure.

Container ship advised prior to port entry that they had equipment failures including one engine breakdown, and one generator out of service. Shore service team attended and a risk assessment was carried out prior to leaving previous port.
Barge went up onto the bank on the side of a channel, the barge backed up and proceeded to berth. There was no damage or injuries.
Surge came through as vessel was departing berth and made contact with the hull of the ship anchored next to it. There was some minor damage and no injuries.

Vessel being delivered from overseas reported a loud thump and smoke coming from the emergency UPS battery room. Batteries had broken loose in rough weather, then shorted on the deck. There was no fire.
Event Location: North of Indonesia, en route to NZ

Brief Description: During testing on a cargo ship it was noted that the Reduction Gearbox oil temperature increased. The vessel was to remain at berth until the root cause was found and rectified.
Jet boat became beached after a spin. There were no injuries or damage.
Jet ski overturned during a training of new crew on how to handle one in surf conditions. There were no injuries or damage.
Mooring line on container ship snapped whilst at berth. Port employees found all other mooring lines to be degraded. The port requested immediate corrective action.
While returning from training exercise, one engine malfunctioned so had to return to berth on one engine.
Grounding of recreational vessel.  No environmental effects as spill was prevented.
Crew person was cutting bait and cut off tip of left thumb. Was taken into port and met by ambulance, treated at A&E and delivered back to fishing vessel.
Whilst ship was shifting in the harbour a catamaran came through and passed across the head of the ship. Short and rapid blasts were sounded but the catamaran continued on.
Whilst ship was shifting in the harbour a catamaran came through and passed across the head of the ship. Short and rapid blasts were sounded but the catamaran continued on.
Longline fisherman got hook stuck in hand after the line got stuck. The hook was removed onboard and wound cleaned.
Pilot ladder was found to have certified manropes but with back splice on the end. Master and deck crew informed.
Vessel was coming into berth with a stronger than normal tidal current, the stern was pushed around and the boat made contact with another vessel. There were no injuries.
After yacht crossed into the path of a bulk carrier, master tried unsuccessfully to sound ship's whistle. The pilot assisted in moving ship out of the channel and avoided a near miss.
Rescue vessel called out to a capsized rowing skiff with a person who was unable to get back on board. Person and skiff were taken to base and the person was taken to hospital as very cold.
A Stevedore climbing up the accommodation gangway hit their nose and face against a support beam. First aid was applied and stevedore was taken to medical centre by ambulance.
Car ferry made contact with mooring dolphin whilst berthing, causing some damage to the vessels starboard belting.
Tanker's main generator shut down, and the fault was found to be with the Fuel Injection Pump Actuator. The vessel was operational but needed tug assistance until the fault was cleared.
Jetboat hit shallow bar and ran aground. There was no damage or injuries.

As passenger vessel was approaching berth the wind picked up and pushed the boat sideways, causing it to come in contact with wooden pilings and then into another vessel. There was minor damage to both vessels.

As passenger vessel was approaching berth the wind picked up and pushed the boat sideways, causing it to come in contact with wooden pilings and then into another vessel. There was minor damage to both vessels.
Crew member sustained a cut to their hand while processing fish product, requiring stitches performed by vessel medic.
Whilst coming out of a gybe the helmsman put their foot on the edge of the boat and misjudged the width, their foot landed on the metal railing and the helmsman slipped and fell overboard.

Two sailboats collided during a race, one was unable to bear away and the other did a fast gybe to try and avoid but it collided anyway. directly after one of the boats was doing a quick gybe and the jib hit a crew person pushing them into the water.
Fatal recreational boating accident.
Crew person in IRB fell out of boat during a turn and was subsequently hit by the boat, sustaining a laceration to the left side of their face.
Whilst gybing crew person stood up before the boom came down and was hit by it. Crew person was knocked unconscious.
Pilot ladder was found to be non compliant as the tripping line was in the wrong position.
Non-compliant pilot ladder.  Tripping line rigged in wrong position.  Ships crew and pilot notified.
Container ship en route to New Zealand reported its GMDSS equipment power amplifier was not operational due to damaged capacitor and PCB card. Arrangement was made to replace once in port.
Fishing vessel ran aground.  No injuries. Harbourmaster organised tugs for salvage.
While vessel was turning, chief engineer requested reduced speed to slow ahead due to issues with the engine cooler. After a few minutes the engineer gave all clear to increase back to half ahead.
Non-compliant pilot boarding arrangement, man ropes not made of manila rope.
Starboard engine of passenger ferry lost power whilst making a turn to approach the terminal. Skipper radioed to all traffic and safely docked at another berth.
Pilot ladder substandard with loose chocks and chocks missing.
Jetboat driver took wrong turn and beached.
Event Location: Downstream of Power Poles, Dart river

Brief Description: During jetboat training the driver had difficulty getting the boat off the beach, causing it to drift towards the bridge pillar and making contact with it.
During jetboat training the boat was partially beached. Crew member disembarked and refloated the boat.
Vessel dragged anchor during the night and drifted onto a beach, the anchor watch alarm woke crew who called for assistance to tow. Vessel had superficial damage.
While turning into wharf, vessel made contact with a wharf pile which brought the vessel to a sudden halt. Two passengers sustained minor injuries.
The pilot advised the ladder was not straight and pilotage was aborted until the ladder was replaced.
While alongside berth, auxiliary diesel generator failed as engine room prepared for cargo operation.  Unloading cargo stopped and crew told to prepare for possible black out.

Starboard side pilot accommodation ladder was unable to be moved out from its stowed position. Pilot switched to port side, but vessel's port side accommodation ladder platform lower than minimum required level.
While boarding the Pilot noted the pilot ladder was worn, with loose chocks and minor rope damage to the securing line at the top of the ladder.
Crew member fell from step while operating vessel crane, landing on their back and hitting their head.
Jet ski with two people broke down and started taking on water.  Coastguard rescued passengers and towed jet ski back to shore.
Jetboat grounded while travelling up river.
Jet boat grounded after taking wrong channel. Passengers transferred safely to another vessel and jet boat towed back to berth.

Crew person opened door of freezer at the same time as the boat lurched causing the door to swing open and slam onto their hand. Assessment by A&E confirmed the thumb was fractured and surgery was required.
Two non-compliant Pilot Ladders.  Starboard side, ladder stretched with loose chocks.  Port side, stretched and not horizontal, loose chocks and poor condition.
Person reported missing from a boat on the river. Subsequent Police enquires found the victim had anchored and gone to shore, with the disappearance not related to the vessel.
Pilot ladder on container ship was found to have loose chocks underfoot. The ship was informed it needed to be replaced.
Pilot ladder man ropes were secured to the handrail as there was no available ring plate on deck.
Fatal recreational boating accident.
Jetboat became beached in a channel on the Shotover river.
Observer on vessel sustained a piercing injury while handling a spiny dog shark. Basic first aid applied and voyage continued.
Jetboat developed a leak in hull whilst travelling down river, the bilge pump also stopped working and the boat ended up sinking. There were no injuries.
During routine vessel checks on a tanker it was noted that the fibre glass floor of the rescue boat was showing cracks. Vessel has back up rescue gear and floor of rescue boat was to be repaired.
Jetboat came across two kayakers directly in the drive line. The jetboat was unable to deviate due to obstacles and passed at a slow speed.
Event Location: 400m downstream from Te Marie Bridge, Whanganui River

Brief Description: During a planned spin, vessel grounded. Passengers transferred ashore.  Vessel pushed off bar and collected passengers downstream.

Cargo was being discharged from bulk carrier when the shore grab made contact with and damaged one of the water ballast tanks. The water inside tank was transferred to another tank. Part of the cargo was water damaged. There were no injuries.
Container ship's bow thruster failed during approach to berth. Tugs assisted vessel into port.
Jet boat grounded during a planned spin. Boat recovered by tractor tow.
Crew member on yacht jumped off to help berth the boat and dislocated their knee. Surgeon on crew provided first aid before the ambulance arrived. Crew member was transported to hospital.
Charter passenger vessel lost propulsion following the failure of its alternator battery.

Yacht under sail collided with a small fishing vessel. The fishing vessel immediately took on water and began to sink. The two passengers held on until they were picked up by another vessel. There were no injuries.

Yacht under sail collided with a small fishing vessel. The fishing vessel immediately took on water and began to sink. The two passengers held on until they were picked up by another vessel. There were no injuries.
A member of the public noticed a capsized boat. Rescue vessels attended and two occupants were rescued, including one winched to safety by helicopter.
While running downstream doing a boat river test, incorrect channel selection resulting in grounding.
Jet Boat lost power and propulsion. Passengers disembarked on shore. Minor damage to the vessel sustained while idling downstream.

Recreational vessel hit mussel farm backbone causing vessel to stop suddenly and the skipper to be thrown violently within the vessel.  Rescued by Coastguard and hospitalized with broken ribs and vertebrae.
Vessel travelling at speed hit the wake of another vessel, destabilising the vessel and causing one crew member to lose footing and fall, sustaining a minor head injury.
First Engineer had a medical event causing numbness down their left side.
Passenger ferry lost steering and had to secure vessel with anchor. Skipper called for assistance and transferred two passengers to another vessel.
During fuel resupply old and new fuels became mixed causing filters to clog, resulting in a blackout of ship.
Container ship notified of a crack in boiler that had been temporarily repaired and assessed by surveyor. Permanent repair was to be completed before another inspection by attending surveyor.

Main motherboard for a generator on cargo ship failed and generator 2 was also out of service, the two larger generators were fully operational and running as normal. A module had been ordered for replacement.
Fishing net fouled propeller and stalled the main motor. Vessel was towed back to berth by Coastguard.
As a result of auto twist lock not releasing, single empty container fell onto deck of vessel.
Boat with three passengers onboard was swamped and capsized by a wave. No injuries sustained.
While undertaking driver training, the IRB struck a submerged surfer on the head.  Surfer lifted onboard and returned to shore for treatment.
Jet Boat travelling downstream starboard engine lost power while up on the plane. Unloaded 13 passengers and returned to base on one engine.
Commanding Officer of a container ship disembarked for medical reasons as advised by doctor as unfit for duty.
Failure of Autopilot/Trackpilot. Vessel was able to be safely navigated with hand steering.
Loss redundancy on PA system as required for passenger ships.  Mitigation measures in place.

Half an hour after surfacing, a diver from a commercial dive team advised they had chest pain and a tight feeling in upper chest, the team followed emergency medical protocol and sought medical advice. Boat returned to ramp and met ambulance.
Event Location: Southwest Home Bay, Great Mercury Island

Brief Description: Water pump had air lock causing hose to heat up and split. Hot water sprayed out, burning crew members chest.
Fatal recreational boating accident.
Jetski driver lost sight of the next wave due to wash, the conditions were unpredictable and the driver was consequently knocked off.
Container ship pilot ladder was found to be non compliant with lower steps not horizontal, stretched on one side and with numerous loose chocks.
Crew member was walking across gangway when they slipped between vessel and pier edge, sustaining bruising to their legs and arm.
While on route to berth, port main engine clutch slip warning alarm sounded. Port main engine stopped and issue identified.  Repairs to be undertaken in port.
Ladder rung gave way as digger operator was exiting Hold 1 of vessel.
Jetboat drifted towards bank and grounded after driver turned into corner.
When pilot was disembarking cargo ship they noted the pilot ladder was of poor quality with loose chocks allowing treads to rotate. The man ropes were also non-compliant with large knots at the ends.
Fishing trawler's main engine alarm sounded as the engine was shutting down. The backup engine then started automatically. Engineers worked through the system to locate and fix the issue.
Propulsion failure due to engine mount not securely bolted during recent cam shaft repair.
Driver on a practice run with a IRB lost balance and fell from the vessel.
Both radars on containership ceased functioning. Technician was assigned to repair at next port.
Tender was tied to pile.  Pile collapsed, pushing the stern underwater.
Vessel came into contact with seabed.  Were able to back off and resume voyage.  After inspection, damage to one propeller blade.
When disembarking bulk carrier pilot found the ladder to be in good condition and correctly rigged but was of poor quality with loose chocks, allowing the treads to rotate.
Individual fishing from their boat fell overboard and required assistance as they were unable to swim. Rescue helicopter attended and person was retrieved from water.
Charter vessel lost steering and had to berth with emergency steering drill and tiller arm.
Fishing vessel was towing a dinghy in rough weather when the rope broke and the dinghy was lost.
Fishing vessel was towing a dinghy in rough weather when the rope broke and the dinghy was lost.
Container ship experienced malfunction of the remote steering system. Equipment was to repaired and engine room was to be manned at all times prior to repair.
River levels dropped below normal, and after completing a planned spin jet boat hit a rock.
Crew member lost footing and injured their back. over the next couple of hours their condition deteriorated and an ambulance was called. Crew member was assessed in hospital.
Low quality pilot ladder was stretched resulting in loose chocks and rotating steps.
Barge travelled to collect gear from the beach and hit a submerged item which punctured the port forward hull. Hole was patched up and vessel returned to port to be slipped and repaired.
At end of a planned turn, vessel made contact with ground causing small amount of damage to the protective bull bar. No injuries.
Skipper attempted to cross bar into harbour by waiting for a gap in the swell, however, during crossing surf appeared and overturned the vessel. Vessel was towed back to harbour.
Crossing bar when wave broke on the bow of vessel, causing damage to upper port bow section above the deck line.
Pump to day tank failed, causing loss of propulsion. Coastguard towed vessel back to port.
Distance from accommodation ladder to pilot ladder was wide apart and accommodation ladder was not secured to hull correctly.  Disembarkation was delayed until deficiencies were rectified.
Person was rescued from the water after their boat caught fire close to the entrance of a harbour.
On approach to slipway, vessel briefly grounded. Backed vessel off without incident.
Crew of a fishing vessel were setting a net when a crew member's foot became trapped in the back of the net, dragging it into the net roller. Crew member received treatment and stiches in hospital.

Ferry undergoing maintenance was found to have cracks in two of the gear teeth, and a higher than normal vibration in one of the gearboxes. Vessel was assessed by surveyor and some sailings were to be cancelled while new parts were in transit.
Fatal accident during a commercial operation.
Pallet jack used to stow pallets reversed over stevedore's foot and leg. Stevedore was sent to hospital for treatment.

Vessel was making routine journey when a deckhand detected the smell of fuel. Fuel discovered leaking from fuel breather hole on the side of the ship. Engine was stopped immediately. Vessel returned to base and fuel cleaned up with spill kit.
Ferry had a complete power outage whilst coming into port. Both engines and steering were down for 10 minutes, ferry was assisted into berth with the help of a tug.

Passenger ferry became aware of another vessel within close vicinity. Ferry reduced speed, sounded whistle and attempted contact on VHF. With no communication the ferry eventually aborted passage until the other vessel was sighted.
Crew member had an allergic reaction after ingesting food on board vessel. Crew member transferred to hospital for treatment.
Crew member was pulling in fishing line, when the line went slack and a hook went through the persons thumb. Was assessed in hospital.
During scheduled maintenance checks on a container ship, the chief officer caught their hand between the anchor chain and the anchor guide post, causing a serious injury.
Vessel made contact with navigational buoy when entering harbour.

Two vessels were leaving port when another vessel approached to pass on starboard side. Oncoming vessel altered direction to starboard cutting across a short distance away to pass on port side. 5 short blasts were sounded.

Two vessels were leaving port when another vessel approached to pass on starboard side. Oncoming vessel altered direction to starboard cutting across a short distance away to pass on port side. 5 short blasts were sounded.
Vessel was pushing a barge when the skipper noticed the vessel was not responding to steering controls. The vessel was stopped, the issue investigated and the rudder shaft was found to be broken.

Vessel was making routine journey, trailer onboard carrying LPG. Strong smell of gas was reported by crew. Trailer was inspected and deemed unsafe, so was docked and Fire Department notified and attended.
Beacon distress signal received from vessel with torn sails. Ship within vicinity responded, skipper advised they would return to port under own power.
Damaged yacht lost propulsion and required assistance to tow vessel into port.
Vessel grounded whilst making a planned turn.
Crew member noticed two small holes in engine room hull, they were plugged to stop ingress of water. Repairs were completed.
Crew noticed electrical burning smell, smell was identified and breakers turned off. Crew member continued fire watch.
Crew member was evacuated off fishing vessel after suffering a medical episode.
Passenger on ferry suffered a medical episode, vessel returned to harbour.
Pilot ladder was found to be non-compliant, steps were loose and not parallel. Crew were asked to fix or replace.
Fishing vessel sank after collision with rocks. Two crew members airlifted to hospital.
Crew member found a passenger losing consciousness. Vessel returned to marina and passenger was transported to hospital.
Pilot ladder poorly constructed with loose chocks allowing trends to rotate underfoot.
After lifting vessel off berth, vessel experienced a problem with bridge control of main engine. Vessel returned to berth and control restored.
Crew member fell on the deck during mooring operation and sustained a fractured arm.
The ship to shore crane was performing a lift on the vessel. When the containers were lifted out of the vessel's hold, the containers became detached from the crane spreader.
Fatal recreational boating accident.
Pilot ladder was found to have multiple loose chocks, causing the steps to rotate under foot. The tripping line was also rigged lower than the lowest spreader.
Generator on fishing vessel shut down due to possible fuel contamination. Vessel towed towards port whilst checks were completed.
Driver of the vessel misjudged a small wave when riding parallel to the shore, causing the boat to flip sideways.
Crane operator on container ship was watching the crane's claw and failed to observe another crane nearby, leading to a collision between them.
Vessel lost power due to blown coolant pipe. A temporary fix was put in place and the vessel waited in a sheltered position until another boat arrived to retrieve the vessel.
Engine failed to fire when pilot requested main engine dead slow ahead.  After several attempts tugs were called to support. A few minutes later engine fired and journey continued.

Vessel approached the turn around the point, increased the speed. The new speed was too high for the tight turn so the master stopped the vessel, at which point the tide and wind carried the vessel, making contact with the outer marina posts.
Vessel was moving between berths when master corrected course to avoid a beam. The vessel continued onto berth and came into contract with square fender pile.
Vessel's engine failed to start on departure due to reported water in start system. Water was drained from the system and engine was started after a few minutes.

Ferry experienced mechanical fault shortly after leaving terminal. After alarms skipper noticed steering was affected, they immediately put emergency plan into place, moved vessel to the side of harbour and advised passengers. Tug assisted to berth.
During the transfer of containers, a carrier came into contact with the hook of a vessel crane which was suspended over the wharf.
Vessel was hit by a second wave hidden by the initial breaking wave, causing the boat to be flipped when turning to the side.
Crew member slipped off a gangway with no handrails whilst boarding the vessel in high winds. Sustained minor injuries.
Vessel's radar began malfunctioning after heavy rain. Vessel took appropriate risk safety measures and service engineer attended vessel at Port of Auckland.
Fire crew attended unattended yacht that was on fire. They were able to extinguish the fire, and the vessel was towed back to port.

Vessel was attempting to cross the bar when the vessel was flipped by two set waves close to each other. Both passengers ended in the water, retrieved some of their gear and crossed the bar into the harbour.
Deckhand was working on the front of the ship whilst mooring lines were being tied. The deckhand stepped backwards and fell from the platform deck to the main deck, resulting in a fractured arm.
Vessel's steering unit became inoperable due to damage to the pump shaft and coupling. Ship was able to navigate safely with a second steering unit.
Crew member was working on the deck of the vessel when a rogue wave came over the boat and swept them off of their feet into a hatch, causing a chest injury.

Vessel had developed leak in the back of the boat which was found by the crew and a dive team was contracted to apply a patch. The leak was monitored on return to harbour and the vessel was taken out of service until repaired.

Vessel's starter motor failed, leaving the boat without power. Call was made to the coast guard and another vessel was dispatched to attempt to start motor with a battery pack but was unsuccessful, so the boat was towed back to port.
Vessel's pilot ladder was found to be shortened using polyprop rope and the loops used to connect the rope were not fit for purpose.
Pilot ladder was found in poor condition with loose and missing chocks.
Passenger ferry grounded on passage to next port as a result of steering failure. There were no injuries and vessel was refloated at next high tide.
Pilot ladder was found to be in poor condition and needed to be replaced. Alternate pilot ladder was newer, but still in a poor condition.

Vessel's pilot ladder stanchion which had the ropes passed through it broke whilst disembarking. Stanchion appeared to have corroded at the lower end which wasn't spotted during previous testing before arrival. Crew stated they would rectify issue.
Vessel was practicing slow training landings when it was discovered the throttle wasn't functioning correctly. Vessel proceeded to harbour, and Coastguard assisted to berth.
During planned spin passenger lost balance and hit their hand, sustaining a finger fracture.

Vessel's pilot ladder was found to be rigged over a wall due to the pilot ladder gate being partially blocked by a wire holding down cargo. No suitable points to attach the ladder were able to be rigged due to this.
Fatal recreational boating accident.
Vessel was performing a routine landing on a concrete ramp in strong winds. Front of the vessel came into contact with the ramp.
Recreational vessel became caught on the net of a trawler. Occupants of the vessel called for help on the radio before the vessel foundered and were rescued by another vessel in the vicinity.
While attempting to tie up vessel, crew member's arm was trapped between the boat and the jetty, resulting in a minor injury.
Witness reported a recreational vessel sitting on its side on the rocks. Witness believed it had drifted overnight.
Deputy Harbourmaster on route back to base came across a double kayak that had flipped and two people in the water.  Took kayakers on board and returned them an kayak to shore.

Vessel was making a routine journey when crew were alerted to a fire and oil pressure alarm, onboard engineer investigated. Oil filter was found to have failed, master decided to return to the marina under a single engine with help from a tugboat.
Vessel reported a shift in cargo during transit and continued onto port. Ship was deemed to be safe to dock.
Vessel's generator experienced an issue and shut down, causing a blackout. Backup generator on standby activated and power was restored.
A fishing vessel berthed behind a sailing vessel made contact with the sailing vessel as they were both moored, causing damage to the bow.
A fishing vessel berthed behind a sailing vessel made contact with the sailing vessel as they were both moored, causing damage to the bow.

Container ship advised of a power failure of the deck auxiliary generator. The fuel filters were found to be blocked due to contamination in the inbuilt fuel tank. The filters were replaced and the generator returned to service.
Crew member slipped whilst boarding vessel, sustaining a minor injury to their hip.
Pilot ladder in poor condition.   Loose chocks and lower steps not horizontal
IRB driver didn't get enough speed up whilst driving away from a peaking wave and the wave crashed over the vessel, causing it to flip.
Vessel was beached intentionally as part of a training exercise. As vessel was relaunched sand entered the engine cooling system and it shut down.
Main engine seized while towing and vessel was towed back to port.
Pilot reported damage to gangway due to metal plate catching on port wharf.
Crew member hit their head on fishing equipment stowed above them, sustaining bruising.
Crew member fell overboard while undertaking IRB training.
IRB driver attempted to proceed over a wave, hitting it at a steep angle and causing the IRB to roll over.

Fishing vessel had a near miss with a container ship, the skipper advised they were trawling with the appropriate lights up and the container vessel did not give way. The fishing vessel took evasive action to avoid a collision.

Fishing vessel had a near miss with a container ship, the skipper advised they were trawling with the appropriate lights up and the container vessel did not give way. The fishing vessel took evasive action to avoid a collision.
Pilot ladder sitting at an irregular angle and had loose chocks.

Refrigeration lines were removed from a fish skinning machine, which caused a vapour to be released, the staff were alerted by someone nearby and the area was ventilated. It was found that a suction valve had been accidentally left open.
Crew member's fingers jammed in bathroom doorway when door swung shut.
Master took evasive action to avoid grounding and put vessel into a sudden reverse causing passenger to fall backward causing injury.  Passenger transported to hospital.
Pilot ladder in poor condition with loose chocks.
Jet boat sunk in river after taking on water, there was a small amount of fuel on board and driver did not see any evidence of fuel in water after the boat sunk. There were no injuries.
Fishing vessel had a small yacht motor into the back right quarter of the boat.

Crew member noticed smoke coming out of the incinerator compartment and the crew shut down the power, opened the compartment and used two fire extinguishers to extinguish the fire. Crew members determined it was a short circuit, parts to be replaced.

During training exercise, vessel was made to refuel and while manoeuvring into the dock, the boat lurched forward and then corrected with reverse which lurched the vessel back. The backwards momentum caused collision with a moored vessel.

During training exercise, vessel was made to refuel and while manoeuvring into the dock, the boat lurched forward and then corrected with reverse which lurched the vessel back. The backwards momentum caused collision with a moored vessel.
Wire snapped on crane hoisting logs into vessel, this caused the claw of the crane to fall into the hold. There were no injuries.
Master of a recreational vessel heaving to was getting some rest when the vessel collided with a fishing vessel. Both vessels sustained minor damage with no injuries.
Master of a recreational vessel heaving to was getting some rest when the vessel collided with a fishing vessel. Both vessels sustained minor damage with no injuries.
Jet boat made slight contact with a tree branch, there was a driver assessor on board who debriefed the driver after the incident. There was no damage or injuries.
Bulk carrier on route to NZ advised they had a defective x-band radar, and only the s-band radar was operational. The issue was reported to Flag Administration.
Vessel was traveling upstream and had too much momentum towards the outside of the corner and ran aground.
Whilst performing a routine turn, water had come over the front of the vessel and cracked the windscreen. Master took the boat to the workshop, swapped it for another vessel and continued the trip.
Crane #2 broke down whilst loading logs, and was suspended above the wharf. Operations were ceased while the ship's staff worked to return the crane to operation.
Skipper of vessel experienced a medical event and was airlifted to hospital.
Event Location: 30 Miles east of Bay of Islands

Brief Description: Vessel was making a routine journey when the master noticed a strong vibration on the right side of the boat so slowed the vessel down. Master returned on one engine and after inspection, shaft from the engine was found to be sheared.

Recreational vessel was out fishing, the weather began to worsen so the master returned to port when the main engine overheated. Whilst checking the engine, the wind pushed the front of the vessel toward the shore and waves carried it onto the beach.

Fishing vessel was drifting in sheltered waters when crew saw rocks in the immediate vicinity, person on watch started the engine in attempt to manoeuvre into safer waters but drove into rocks. Vessel checked for water and divers organised.

Crew member was accessing vessel via gangplank when they turned around to talk to another crew member and lost their footing, causing them to fall and land on a hydraulic pipe. Ribs were bruised and no further injuries.
Vessel was carrying out routine work at low tide when they came into contact with a reef which caused very minor damage to the vessel. Work continued and the boat was inspected and repaired.
Crew member reported chest pains and shortness of breath and was transferred to coast guard vessel to be taken to receive medical attention.

Vessel was carrying out routine preparation for departure when an alarm sounded and one of the main engines shut down. The engine failure was investigated, rectified and tested with no further issues.

Vessel was carrying out routine preparation for departure when an alarm sounded and one of the main engines shut down. The engine failure was investigated, rectified and tested with no further issues.

Pilot ladder was found set up just over the edge of the deck and not through the stanchions as there was no ring for the ropes to go through. Crew and master of vessel had very little knowledge of pilot arrangements and pilot ladder requirements.
Crew member was moving a steel pipe when they trapped a finger which caused the finger to require stitches.

Vessel was switching from one generator to a higher capacity generator, which shut down unexpectedly causing a brief blackout before the emergency power came on. Engineers went back to the previous generator as this was still running.
Crew member on fishing vessel was acting erratically, they were taken to port and then to the hospital for assessment.

During mooring the skipper felt a sudden movement and vibration. The engines were shut down immediately, and the vessel was safely moored. Cause was found to be fouling of the propeller by two of the mooring lines.
IRB rolled over in large wave.
Crew member received a cut to the eye from a spanner they were using, they were taken to hospital for a check up.
Pilot ladder not secured to appropriate strong points on deck and rope lashings leading the wrong way.  Tripping line was rigged two rungs below the bottom spreader.
Pilot ladder had multiple loose chocks and steps that rotated underfoot.
When boarding the pilot ladder swung out from the vessel, pilot inspected the magnets and they did not align with regulations, master was informed and advised new magnets would be ordered.
Truck driver was lifting their gantry when the hook gave way and the trailer dropped to the ground, they then reconnected the trailer and left port without following port incident protocol.
Event Location: C3 Log Yard, Shakespeare Bay, Port Marlborough

Brief Description: Jet boat made contact with a rock on port side rear of the boat causing a hole.  Moved to beach and passengers transferred to another boat.
Vessel was returning from a routine journey when the skipper went through an unfamiliar channel and ran aground. No passengers, injuries or damage.
Vessel was exiting port when the ship concluded their turn at the edge of the dredged channel approximately 10-20m away from running aground.

Whilst cargo was being unloaded from the vessel, the winch dropped out of gear causing the load to swing and make contact with a hatch safety rail. No cargo was dropped and no personnel were within the drop zone of the load.
Pilot ladder manropes were found to be rigged at deck level and looked thin, the ship's master was advised the manropes needed to be passed through the top of the stanchions.
Crew member's jersey got caught on the rope hook on the mariner pillion and was unable to free their arm in time, leading to it becoming crushed between the boat and pillion.
Crew member got fingers caught in equipment, one finger was injured and one was severed. RCCNZ tasked helicopter to meet vessel and take person to hospital.
Vehicle ferry experienced a coolant leak from the cooler drain valve. Crew immediately shut off the valve.
Carrier advised the ship was without main engine propulsion. Ship was berthed awaiting assessment.
Recreational vessel sent out a mayday call and activated their beacon as they were experiencing a medical event and requested removal from their vessel as they couldn't get themselves to shore.
Fatal recreational boating accident.
Pilot ladder was found to be poorly constructed with timber chocks that were not secured correctly, and turned underfoot.

During the inbound pilotage of a container ship there was a close quarters situation with a fishing vessel. The fishing vessel did not respond on radio but altered course after two blasts of the ship's whistle.

During the inbound pilotage of a container ship there was a close quarters situation with a fishing vessel. The fishing vessel did not respond on radio but altered course after two blasts of the ship's whistle.

Whilst stepping onto the dock to tie the vessel up, the crew member slipped on the side of the boat and into the water. Crew member was wearing a lifejacket and was able to get themselves onto the dock.
New equipment failed on fishing vessel causing a hook to snap back and pass through a window. Two windows were damaged, no injuries occurred.

Jet boat was travelling downstream when the driver failed to steer around a log and the boat became airborne, skipper and passenger both lifted off their seats and the passenger impacted the side of the boat, injuring their pelvis and thigh.
Two winches on bulk carrier were inoperable, master advised the only was to let go of the lines was to cut them. Vessel was in a safe position and linesmen were advised.
Vessel was making a routine journey through the gorge when the boat came into contact with a rock causing cosmetic damage.

Vessel was using a fire pump and hose when the hose became blocked by a suspected kink so pressure built up and disconnected form the pump, flooding engine room. Flooding cleared and continued voyage.
Passenger ferry advised of a minor fuel leak, cause due to abrasion from vibration. Line was isolated and drained.

Manropes on chemical tanker were found to be too small in diameter. Pilot asked for the ropes to be removed and used the pilot ladder only to embark. Operator was advised manropes needed to be replaced with compliant ropes.
Fishing vessel ran aground due to low tide and silt buildup, the vessel refloated a short while later on the incoming tide.
Vessel had struck an object in the water, witness reported a log in the wake of the boat.
A container stacker tipped forward, overbalanced and came to rest on the container. Scene was held and released.
Jet boat port engine failed. The boat continued on and stopped in a safe location.

Vessel was entering harbour and needed to turn around using a left turn instead of a right turn due to wind strength and direction but did not complete the procedure to do this and carried too much speed causing vessel to come close to a hazard.
Recreational Vessel collided with a fishing trawler sustaining no damage to either vessel. Recreational vessel confirmed their navigation lights were non-functional, contributing to the contact.
Recreational Vessel collided with a fishing trawler sustaining no damage to either vessel. Recreational vessel confirmed their navigation lights were non-functional, contributing to the contact.
Damage to cargo hold causing oil leak.
Equipment failure - bilge pump not operational.
UPS unit starting smoking.  Crew unplugged unit and disembarked passengers from opposite end of the vessel.  Crew on fire watch.   Passengers re-boarded and no further issues.
Fatal recreational boating accident.
Pilot ladder was reported to have loose chocks and when inspected whilst onboard, pilot ladder was found to be of poor quality.
Pilot ladder spreader broken.  Boarding delayed until new ladder rigged.
Capsize during training exercise, no injuries or damage.
Vessel secured to berth at low tide it was noticed that the vessel was aground.
Pontoons of vessel starting taking on water.  Boat listed to one side so boat grounded on beach to get people off safely.
While negotiating around moored vessels, the vessel made contact with the sandy ground.  Vessel was backed off under own power and proceeded back to berth. No damage or injury.
Crew member suffered injury to neck after heavy lifting. Crew member reported intense pain so medevac was arranged for them to receive treatment.
Pilot ladder was found to have loose chocks on most steps and so rotated underfoot.
Light vehicle drove over a footpath, ran over a power box and became stuck.
Grounding during planned turn.

Vessel was returning from a routine journey when the left engine dropped in power without any alarms. Engine was shut down and attempted to restart without success so entered channel and docked with one engine.
Fatal medical event on port.
Pilot refused to use ladder due to loose chocks.  New ladder installed and Pilot boarded.
Pilot ladder was found to be of poor construction with many loose chocks. Master informed pilot that new ladders are on order.
Ship made contact with wharf while berthing resulting in 2-3 metre hole above the waterline.
Commercial vessel came into close quarter situation with passenger vessel while crossing harbour.
Commercial vessel came into close quarter situation with passenger vessel while crossing harbour.
Pilot ladder on tanker was found to be damaged and unsafe to climb, the bottom wooden spreader was on an angle. Master was advised.
Medical Event requiring member of crew to be taken to hospital
Recreational jet boat rolled after a hitting a rock. There were no injuries and boat had a few dents.
Harbourmaster advised there was a commercial fishing vessel grounded in a bay.
Propeller entangled underneath tug boat while berthing another vessel
Cargo ship was approaching port when the engine went into shut down. Tugs were notified and after engine was restarted it came back online. The tugs escorted the vessel into port.
Commercial vessel suffered 45 minute black out during pre-checks. After this vessel was able to continue into port without further incident. Cause was to be investigated.
Injury to crew member due to gantry hook hitting the side of their face.  Sent to hospital.
Cargo Ship reported seawater in the engine room bilges. The water was pumped out and the cause was to be investigated.

Commercial vessel was following a trawler when the trawler turned hard to port, cutting across the bow of the other vessel. The first vessel took evasive action to avoid a collision and tried calling the trawler but received no answer.
Pilot ladder incorrectly rigged.
Fishing trawler broke its mooring in strong winds overnight, and grounded on a mud bank. Skipper refloated the vessel on the next high tide. There was no damage to the vessel.

New commercial vessel was being refuelled on land when there was a loud bang and fire from the bridge. Fire was put out with extinguisher and 111 called. Vessel was collected by manufacturer for investigation.
Mechanical failure of steering gear.  Applied temporary fix before returning to port.
High winds caused vessel to break free from its mooring and made contact with a nearby intake valve.  No damage or injuries.

Worker was carrying out general duties unloading boxes from shelving pallet when it became unstable on the forklift forks and tilted forward, hitting the worker on their left side. Medical certificate was received.
Port team identified unsafe lashing on a container ship and advised crew not to unlash without fall protection. Crew were later observed unlashing the containers without any protection.
Fatal medical event on port.
All chocks on pilot ladder were loose and steps rotated underfoot.

Jet ski carrying passenger capsized at slow speed and the passenger entered the water where they spent a significant amount of time. Family member entered the water from second jet ski and injured their shoulder whilst assisting. Coastguard attended.

Vessel was entering the harbour and moved over in the channel to give another boat room and came into contact with the bottom as beacon No.2 was unlit. Vessel was returning to the channel and touched beacon No.3. No significant damage to vessel.
Whilst hauling cray pot the rope slipped, resulting in the cray pot flipping over the boom and hitting a crew member on the head and back.
Fatal recreational boating accident.

Fishing vessel was experiencing rough weather and the skipper left the wheelhouse to check on crew after vessel was turned by large swell. Skipper disengaged auto pilot but hit the reef twice before backing away and being towed back to harbour.

Vessel sounded a low oil alarm and engineer found oil spilling from gear box. Smoke and oil mist was developing  from gear box, chief engineer activated the emergency stop and the fire alarm. Engine room ventilated and root cause analysis to be done.

Whilst picking up a container onto their trailer, the front of the container has passed the centreline and has fallen down onto the other side of the trailer into the exclusion zone. The chain remained connected and crane module suffered some damage.

Vessel was slowing down entering the marina when they heard a noise on the left side which was inspected after berthing, discovered a coupling was visibly damaged and engine mounts broken. Vessel taken out of service for inspection and repair.

Container ship was found to have had multiple recent issues with engine and equipment. Once on board the pilot also noticed none of the rudder indicators were working. Ship was refused pilotage and sent back to anchorage.

Vessel was preparing freezer lobby for hauling when engineers noticed a smell of ammonia and notified the bridge. The automatic ammonia alarm sounded, all crew exited and were accounted for then the freezer lobby was ventilated and freezers checked.
Vessel was exiting the harbour when a fishing boat was seen drifting without power. Once vessel was escorted out of the harbour, the tug returned to assist and towed the fishing boat back to port.

Vessel was making a routine journey when the driver noticed the smell of smoke in the boat so they stopped on the shore and disembarked the passengers before using the onboard fire extinguisher to put out a small electrical fire.
Vessel was making a routine journey when their engine cut out and would not restart so they dropped anchor and contacted the coastguard. Local vessel was able to assist and tow the vessel to dock.
Commercial fishing vessel hit a tree above the water line, cause was low sun resulting in poor visibility. The vessel was to be repaired in dock.
Pilot ladder was found to be in poor condition with multiple loose checks so steps turned under foot.
Pilot ladder was found to have obvious impact damage to a pair of chocks and multiple chocks were very loose.

Vessel was exiting port when they experienced a steering gear malfunction and went to anchor to wait for technician to attend. Vessel cleared to complete their journey but issues raised at the lack of malfunction details given to Harbourmaster.
Pilot made a mistake while piloting vessel but this was not challenged by the bridge team causing vessel to end up outside the dredged channel for a period of time.
Vessels were performing training exercises causing multiple capsizes in the waves. No injuries or damage.
During a training exercise the vessel was stationary when hit by a wave and capsized.

Passenger ferry port main engine was not able to be started, pilot valve was replaced but did not resolve issue. Ferry moved off berth but was still experiencing issues and decision was made to return to berth.

Worker was conducting pre-start checks when hydraulic fluid was found on a step and was wiped off. The hydraulic fluid mixed with the rain water and the worker slipped off the step onto the ground and was admitted to hospital.
During routine safety checks at sea, vessel was found to have a defective emergency fire pump, engine lubrication oil pressure alarm and a minor leak in an engine water line. All issues rectified.
Pilot ladder was found to have loose chocks on the lower steps causing them to rotate under foot.
Pilot ladder presented was found to be below standard whilst compliant ladder was onboard.
Pilot ladder was found to have loose chocks on lower steps.
Fatal recreational boating accident.
Crane grab had an uncontrolled release of product. No persons were in the vicinity so no risk of harm.
Seal degraded on starboard jet unit on commercial vessel, there was a minor inrush of water which was managed by the automatic bilge pump and alarm. The vessel was dry docked immediately.
Vessel was going alongside another ship to make a delivery when the vessel made contact with the ship causing minor damage to a railing and a light.
Vessel was going alongside another ship to make a delivery when the vessel made contact with the ship causing minor damage to a railing and a light.
Fatal recreational boating accident.
Grounding on sandy beach following anchor drag in bad weather.

Vessel was departing harbour, and after pilot disembarked it was noted the propeller was not responding correctly. The port was advised and a pilot and two tugs were dispatched. The vessel returned to port with assistance.
During club training, IRB engine failed to start, resulting in being pushed into the wave and capsizing.
Yacht capsized while crossing bar, throwing skipper out and causing injury to a child. The child sustained a deep head laceration and was unconscious for periods of time. EMTs and Police attended.
Event Location: Approximately 0.5nm to NW of N end of Haulashore Island, approaching Nelson cut

Brief Description: Loose chocks on Pilot ladder
While carrying out maintenance on vessel a cloud of cement dust blew into the eyes of a crew member. Crew member was transported to A&E to have eyes flushed.
Faults identified in vehicle fire detection loop.

Skipper of recreational yacht reported a passenger ferry tried to force their vessel to cross a channel unnecessarily by intentionally heading directly towards them. Ferry passed within a couple of meters of yacht at excess speed.

Skipper of recreational yacht reported a passenger ferry tried to force their vessel to cross a channel unnecessarily by intentionally heading directly towards them. Ferry passed within a couple of meters of yacht at excess speed.
Gust of wind ripped autohelm off commercial sailing vessel, the mizzen mast then collapsed and fell over the side. Vessel was secured by skipper.

Whist moving a container ship between berths, the vessels propulsion system failed and the main engine had to be stopped by emergency system, control of bow thruster was also lost. Vessel was berthed by tugs.
Trespasser walked along perimeter of port and fell down a hill. The person suffered cuts and abrasions and was picked up by someone not employed by the port, and taken to hospital.
Wood chip pile collapsed on port.
Whilst departing the wharf, crew member was waiting to untie the vessel when the rope slipped and whipped their hand, breaking their thumb.
Fishing vessel lost propulsion and dropped anchor. Skipper notified Coastguard and vessel was to be towed by another fishing vessel later in the day.
Pilot ladder was found to be in poor condition with multiple loose chocks and steps that turned under foot.

Container ship's beacon broke out of its cradle and rolled down to the next deck, the Hydrostatic Release Unit (HRU) was lost and the cradle cover broken. The shore based contractor was to send a technician to next port for repairs.
During training session IRB rolled over after misjudging wave.
Barge hull was damaged whilst working alongside pier, and the barge foundered overnight. It was later salvaged.
Worker was assembling a shelf when stepping backwards came into contact with a sharp pointed edge of a steel plate puncturing their hip.
Vessel lost steering whilst leaving wharf, was towed to another wharf and was found to have a loose steering arm.
Pilot ladder was found to have multiple loose chocks and steps rotated under foot.
Vessel was outbound from port when a fishing vessel entered the channel and failed to respond to radio signals, causing a near miss with the vessel.
Crew member caught their hand in a tangle of the fishing line and was pulled overboard then recovered back onboard immediately.

Tug was coming alongside the vessel to attach a rope when the master made a turn away to avoid the turbulent water from the vessel's propeller. The tug rotated too quickly making heavy contact with the vessel causing the deckhand to fall over.

Tug was coming alongside the vessel to attach a rope when the master made a turn away to avoid the turbulent water from the vessel's propeller. The tug rotated too quickly making heavy contact with the vessel causing the deckhand to fall over.
Vessel ran out of fuel and requested a tow to shore.
Recreational jet boat struck a rock, causing all occupants to be ejected from the vessel, with two passengers sustaining injuries.
Crew member on board fishing vessel sustained a crush shoulder injury while hauling a net.
Passenger on taxi boat fell on stairs due to sudden movement of boat

Upon vessel's arrival toward port they were awaiting the pilot to be picked up when they manoeuvred around and noticed the air pressure dropping in one of the cylinders. Cylinder head gasket damaged, replaced by crew and checked by surveyor.
During vessel cargo operations the containers being discharged swung and struck the vessel railings causing damage. Rails repaired by ships crew.
Leaking hydraulic hose on gearbox.
Jet boat engine failed, driver stopped in a familiar location and workshop assisted with boat swap.
Vessel was fishing when they noticed an increase in speed and the tension on the main rope becoming loose. Vessel confirmed that the rope had broken and the net had been lost.
Pilot ladder was found to be in poor condition with multiple loose chocks which cause steps to turn underfoot.
Extreme vessel movement experienced by contractor while conducting  maintenance on beacons. Stepping onto the ladder the worker was unbalanced causing them to bump their nose on a ladder rung.
Propulsion failure due to rope being tangled around propeller
Propulsion failure - tugs towed vessel back to port.
Flexible pilot ladder section of combination ladder came away from the shell plating.
During cargo inspection found 16 dangerous goods containers had fallen down.
Vessel blown off berth by unexpected wind gust. Tugs used to maintain control of vessel.
Vessel entering harbour through channel.  Very low tide and vessel touched the mud lightly.  Master stopped, waited 15 minutes then continued.  No harm, no damage.
Jet boat beached at low speed after the channel entered was not passable.
Event Location: Power Poles river left, Dart River

Brief Description: Commercial fishing vessel was tacking when they collided with a recreational fishing boat. Neither vessel noticed the other before the collision. There was some damage to both vessels.
Event Location: Hole in the Wall Passage, just NW of Flat Island

Brief Description: Commercial fishing vessel was tacking when they collided with a recreational fishing boat. Neither vessel noticed the other before the collision. There was some damage to both vessels.
Event Location: Hole in the Wall Passage, just NW of Flat Island

Brief Description: Crew member on fishing vessel fell down stairs and injured back. They experienced numbness in legs and could not feel their feet.
Crew members finger was caught by upper section of stuffing box. First aid applied then taken to hospital by ambulance.
Vessel was sitting at a fuel stop until low tide when it grounded, vessel was refloated on the tide.
Pilot ladder was found to be in poor condition, with multiple loose chocks and steps that rotated under foot. Ladder was to be replaced.

Ship's crew were retrieving the gangway when a section of the gangway failed. The gangway then fell into the harbour, and was left hanging by the wires at the forward end. The crew were able to retrieve the ladder and pull onboard.
Starboard engine on jetboat stopping running whilst on a training run. The driver drove back to base under the power of one engine. The fault was traced to a faulty coil.
Event Location: On Dart River approx 2km above the Dart bridge

Brief Description: An individual was in the water whilst a vessel and two tugs were exiting port. All vessels travelled under 5 knots and the person was not harmed.
Event Location: Entrance to Lyttelton Inner Harbour adjacent to Eastern mole navigational aide

Brief Description: An individual was in the water whilst a vessel and two tugs were exiting port. All vessels travelled under 5 knots and the person was not harmed.
Event Location: Entrance to Lyttelton Inner Harbour adjacent to Eastern mole navigational aide

Brief Description: An individual was in the water whilst a vessel and two tugs were exiting port. All vessels travelled under 5 knots and the person was not harmed.
Event Location: Entrance to Lyttelton Inner Harbour adjacent to Eastern mole navigational aide

Brief Description: Workers advised unsafe practices are being carried out, including removal of asbestos without proper licensing or equipment, and engine maintenance is being ignored or neglected.
Whilst offloading, one of the passengers tripped and fell, landing on their shoulder breaking their collarbone. The passenger received first aid and was medevac'd and taken to hospital.
Event Location: Fiordland National Park, Moturau Beach (parked at beach)

Brief Description: Lower rungs of pilot ladder not parallel due to ladder stretched on one side.  Conditions favourable for boarding.  Master indicated vessel has two spare ladders on board to replace damaged ladder.
Ladder in poor condition. Multiple loose chocks, steps rotate underfoot. Ladder must be replaced
Fire spontaneously occurred in the machine house of the I-Crane. The incident required the fire brigade to come in and put out the fire. The fire was contained at 10:10pm.
A recreational jet boat was observed travelling at a speed estimated to be 40 kph up a river.
Event Location: Hutt River, north of the Silverstream Bridge

Brief Description: Truck driver had to manually release the tailgate before unloading, and in doing so slipped on a grid and injured arm.
Pilot Ladder - multiple loose chocks causing steps to rotate underfoot.
Ship’s GPS no.2 failed after sailing. Vessel now sailing with one GPS.
Passenger tripped and injured hip whilst embarking on ferry. Ambulance was called.
Event Location: Western side of the Viaduct, Auckland Harbour

Brief Description: Yacht hit another yacht from behind during a race. The vessel in front swung around, snapping the mast and ripping the chain plates and rigging. The crew cut the rigging to disentangle, and dropped it with a buoy, where it was retrieved the next day.
Event Location: Between Auckland Port and Stanley Point

Brief Description: Pilot ladder was found to be in poor condition with lower treads not being level. Pilot ladder's serial number did not match documentation provided in pre-arrival advice.
Vessel reported to have sank in a river. Emergency services called to the scene and assisted with the rescue. Two in serious condition, one in moderate condition.
Coastguard picked up an ill crew member off a fishing vessel.

Vessel experienced winch failure so was unable to pull up their anchor and attached a float to be able to come back for the anchor. Due to the weather, they were unable to get back to the anchor for six days and the anchor was lost.
IRB rollovers during a drivers exam. There were no injuries or damage.
Pilot ladder was found to be in poor condition with multiple loose chocks near the bottom allowing steps to rotate under foot.
Container ship reported an injury to crew member after they tripped on a mooring rope. The ship returned to port and crew member was transferred to hospital by ambulance.
Vessel was performing training when they took a wrong line and grounded.
The bottom step and spreader were uneven on the pilot ladder of a container ship. Master was advised to take ladder out of service.
Fatal accident during a commercial operation.
Vessel was performing a routine journey when they became grounded. Passengers were transferred to a spare boat and the original vessel was able to be pushed off the bank and continued.

Collision between rowing ladies coxless quad and motor boat.  Despite signalling,  motor boat did deviate course and ran over the paddles of two rowers.  Motor boat did not stop to do a welfare check.

Collision between rowing ladies coxless quad and motor boat.  Despite signalling,  motor boat did deviate course and ran over the paddles of two rowers.  Motor boat did not stop to do a welfare check.
Passenger tripped on a step, falling and injuring themselves. Taken via ambulance to hospital with a broken hip.
Vessel experienced issue with with gyrocompass during bad weather.

Recreational vessel was anchored whilst fishing when a commercial fishing vessel came within 5 meters of the boat with no one at the helm. Fishing vessel had got their lines wrapped around the anchor and bait pot which had to be cut free.

Recreational vessel was anchored whilst fishing when a commercial fishing vessel came within 5 meters of the boat with no one at the helm. Fishing vessel had got their lines wrapped around the anchor and bait pot which had to be cut free.

Vessel was returning to berth when a passenger vessel began backing out of their berth causing the vessel to change course to avoid collision. Passenger vessel continued without acknowledging the vessel.

Vessel was returning to berth when a passenger vessel began backing out of their berth causing the vessel to change course to avoid collision. Passenger vessel continued without acknowledging the vessel.
Vessel was undertaking survey work when it ran aground on a reef, causing crew to abandon ship. A fire then broke out on the vessel, leading to it foundering.
Vessel ran aground on sandbar. Passengers were removed from the vessel while crew remained. Vessel refloated later that day.
Vessel broke mooring and grounded on beach.  Able to start vessel and drive off.  No damage, no injuries.
Pilot ladder was found to be of poor construction, despite the vessel being a few months old.
Whilst completing regular planned maintenance, a potential defect of a hydraulic pressure storage reservoir was raised and tested. Issue was solved and new systems to be put into place.
Vessel's crew was tightening a line when the hook holding the line was knocked out, hitting crew member in the head. Crew member was given a painkiller and taken to A&E.
In a review after the journey, passenger complained of a back injury which they claim occurred during a turn made by the vessel.
Vessel was returning from overseas and made contact with something in the water causing damage to their boat.
Event Location: Approximately 450 nm off Fiji in Pacific Ocean.

Brief Description: Vessel was berthing when a strong gust of wind pushed the vessel into the berth fender which broke. Vessel aborted berthing, reported the damage and waited for temporary fender repair. Tug was used as wind speed had increased.
Fatal recreational boating accident.
Event Location: On the Cleddau River, Milford Sound

Brief Description: Vessel was offloading cargo when they experienced hydraulic system problems. Cargo operations were stopped and tug boat support was on standby. Hydraulic system became operational, was tested and cargo operations continued.
Event Location: Whangarei Harbour - ship alongside Jetty 1 Channel terminal Services Marsden point

Brief Description: Passenger on the vessel lost grip on the rail whilst making a turn and their head made contact with the centre bar. First aid was provided and the passenger chose to go to the hospital as a precaution and was given the all clear.
