Whilst carrying out scheduled work and tensioning wires, part of the structure fell into the exclusion zone. No persons hurt.
Event Location: Acidulation stack area at Mount Operations Ballance site on Hewletts Road

Brief Description: Ferry engine went into automatic shut down after entering harbour.

Vessel experienced main engine failure in a critical area of a channel. Tugs were used to slow the vessel, to complete the turn and hold the vessel in place whilst issue was investigated. Tests completed without issue and berthing was successful.

Maintenance was being carried out on a bitumen tank when an operator directed hot bitumen through the line, the bitumen came out of the open section at the top of the tank, and cascaded down to the scaffold and adjacent equipment.

Carrier was berthed in preparation for discharge of cargo, when the ADG (auxiliary deutz generator) went into overspeed, initiating shut down. Fault testing was performed, and the diesel injector pump was removed for repair.
Captain had a medical condition and was airlifted to hospital.
Jet boat sucked up weed into engine causing vessel to stop.   Weed was removed then vessel returned to shore. The passengers were transferred to another vessel to continue the tour.

Passenger on a dolphin encounter trip indicated they were in distress. Passenger was pulled onboard the and was drifting in and out of consciousness.  Taken to Christchurch Hospital by helicopter and treated for seawater aspiration.
A vessel pulled out of the berth and collided with another boat that was sailing towards its berth. There was minimal damage to both vessels.
Event Location: Whangarei Town Basin marina. Hatea River.

Brief Description: A vessel pulled out of the berth and collided with another boat that was sailing towards its berth. There was minimal damage to both vessels.
Event Location: Whangarei Town Basin marina. Hatea River.

Brief Description: Jetboat proceeding upstream and during a planned turn, drove over and hit a submerged wooden bridge pile.

Bulk carrier reported software issue with main engine, whilst inbound under pilotage to port, entry was aborted and vessel was brought alongside with tugs. Issue was found to be a high deviation temperature in an exhaust gas sensor.
Event Location: In bound to Northport - Whangarei Heads

Brief Description: Main engine oil mist detector alarm on ferry went off which caused an auto shut down of the engine. The engine was restarted and the vessel berthed normally.
Operator discovered hole in vessel so pushed vessel onto river bank
Crew person lost balance and fell off jet ski whilst it was operating in a rescue capacity. There were no injuries.
Vessel reported S-band (2ghz) radar as not operational.
Person broke shoulder whilst being towed behind boat.

Vessel crossing bar capsized. Master sustained a fractured femur and another member of crew suffered seawater aspiration. Both were airlifted to hospital. Two other crew sustained laceration injuries.
Contractor engaged a lock that caused a barge to drift 60m away, the barge made contact with two other boats, causing minor scratches to the paint. Barge was secured.
Event Location: Whau River in Te Atatu boat Club

Brief Description: Pilot ladder on container ship was found to be non-compliant for the second time this year, the captain was advised to dispose of the ladder and replace.
Pilot ladder was found to be non compliant with loose chocks and the manrope was too thick.
Vessel passenger sustained serious injuries to their legs after going overboard from the vessel.
Passenger in a fishing tour threw the sinker and the hook became lodged in their hand. The hook was removed in hospital.
Fatal recreational boating accident.
Passenger ferry reported an issue with the one of the bow thrusters causing an arc flash.

During disembarking of the pilot from the vessel, a combination of ladder and gangway were rigged due to the height. The magnet holding the gangway to the hull of the ship popped off possibly due to the rolling of the ship. Crew re-rigged the ladder.

Commercial vessel reported fault code on screen, and the port engine was discovered to be in reverse irrespective of gear selection. Engine was shut down and starboard engine was used to return to berth.
Bag of mussel seed was being moved when the tie snapped, causing the supporting frame to spring back and hit crew member in the face.
Two ferries had a near miss whilst manoeuvring in and out of berth, one of the vessels deployed a fender to avoid contact. There were no injuries or damage
Two ferries had a near miss whilst manoeuvring in and out of berth, one of the vessels deployed a fender to avoid contact. There were no injuries or damage
Jet boat travelling upstream stopped to assess next turn and became grounded.
Near miss between patrol boat and channel marker.
Report from pilot that ship's gangway stanchions did not fit correctly or safely into platform sockets.

Vessel was approaching the wharf when the electronic controls displayed an error message and the vessel was unable to be taken out of gear. Crew tried dropping their anchor and tying onto the wharf but came into contact with another vessel.

Vessel was approaching the wharf when the electronic controls displayed an error message and the vessel was unable to be taken out of gear. Crew tried dropping their anchor and tying onto the wharf but came into contact with another vessel.

Vessel was inbound to port with pilot onboard when alarms sounded and vessel had a very slow response to steering. Vessel and pilot conducted risk assessment and decided to wait until tide had reduced in speed and proceeded under risk assessment.
Recreational canoe sustained damage which caused the canoe to tip and the user to fall out of the vessel.
Event Location: lateral port marker number 18 auckland harbour

Brief Description: Log slid off trailer with driver in close proximity.
Event Location: Truck in scaling shed on the Port.

Brief Description: Witness observed a capsized kayak off the coast and spotted a person in the water. Assistance was called and person in the water was collected. Treatment was provided and the individual's condition improved.
Engine mount sheared bolts causing engine to move in 2m seas. Rescue organized and crew abandoned ship. Vessel scuttled.
Event Location: Beyond off shore - approximately 350nm from New Zealand

Brief Description: Unknown vessel hit moored vessel causing damage.
Whilst lifting empty containers, a container has come loose from one side of the container handler and caused it to become unbalanced and tip on its side.
Event Location: "Top Yard" of Sulphur Point Container Terminal, Port of Tauranga, Mirrielees Road, Tauranga

Brief Description: Pilot ladder was found to loose chocks and the bottom steps were not horizontal.
Vessel was coming into the wharf when thrusters were put into reverse but did not provide any thrust, causing the vessel to come into contact with the wharf causing minor damage to the wharf.
Pilot ladder was found to be loose at the connection points without the securing pins in place.
Pilot ladder was found to have multiple loose chocks to the degree that they could be removed.

Vessel was coming into harbour when another boat which was exiting turned to try to come across the front of the vessel. Vessel sounded their horn then had to do an emergency stop to avoid a collision.
Event Location: In Motuhe Channel travelling from Rakino Island to Downtown Auckland.

Brief Description: Vessel was coming into harbour when another boat which was exiting turned to try to come across the front of the vessel. Vessel sounded their horn then had to do an emergency stop to avoid a collision.
Event Location: In Motuhe Channel travelling from Rakino Island to Downtown Auckland.

Brief Description: Pilot ladder was found to be worn with multiple loose chocks.
Vessel engine failed to fire ahead.  Navigational lights were not turned on.  Lack of Bridge Management.
Event Location: Departing Port at night from Port Taranaki

Brief Description: During a planned turn, jet boat ran aground on rocks and sunk.
Diesel Alternator #1 - malfunctioning load share on auto mode.
Passenger on fishing charter sustained a knife injury to their hand. Coastguard were contacted, who transported the injured party to shore to receive medical assistance.
Engine on runabout failed, causing the vessel to drift onto rocks. The occupants climbed over the rocks unharmed, with the vessel to be removed by the council.
Crane grab on bulk carrier descended rapidly with no warning, the grab landed inside the hopper.
On board dive vessel returning from the Poor Knights Islands, vessel hit a large wave, causing passenger to bounce up off their seat and land against an adjacent seat, hitting their chest and hand.
The starboard engine lost power while underway. The driver stopped in a safe place and swapped all passengers to a new boat. There were no injuries or damage to the boat
Pilot ladder was found to have loose chocks, master was advised it would not be used again.
Propulsion failure when reducing main engine revs.

Skipper leant out a window to speak to occupant of nearby vessel and  accidentally bumped the throttle. The vessel lurched forward and collided with the other vessel, puncturing its port side rear pontoon.

Skipper leant out a window to speak to occupant of nearby vessel and  accidentally bumped the throttle. The vessel lurched forward and collided with the other vessel, puncturing its port side rear pontoon.
Vessel was found to be tilted to a concerning angle due to the weight distribution.
Pilot ladder had loose steps and horizontal spreader.

Engineer advised bridge there was an issue with a generator, and the action needed to address may cause a blackout. Vessel moved away from land and the generator was shut down. Vessel then recommenced journey.
Pilot ladder manropes were not secured correctly to strongpoints on the deck.
Main Engine failed to go astern on multiple attempts after entering harbour.
After refuelling trim of vessel changed and some spillage of marine diesel occurred.
Pilot ladder was found to have multiple loose chocks that turned underfoot.
Light stand fell and hit crew member on the head causing concussion.
Crew member working on moored trawler tripped over and sprained shoulder.
Trawler caught the anchor of a recreational vessel and towed it 30m until the anchor rope broke.
Event Location: At sea north of Mungakuri Beach (Central Hawkes Bay)

Brief Description: Passenger slid across jet boat and collided with the other side. Passenger advised they were most likely only bruised but were going to get a x-ray to be sure.
Crew was walking on the top of a load of logs when the logs suddenly shifted, causing the crew member to slip and catch their foot in between the logs.
Pilot ladder was found to be attached to the vessel railings and not on strongpoints of the deck.
Whilst inspector was boarding the vessel, the gangway was found to be set-up in an unsafe manor by stacking pallets.
Pilot ladder was found to have loose chocks that rotated slightly under foot.
Vessel was being used for a training exercise when the vessel began to experience a partial loss of steering. Vessel returned to berth where repairs were organised.
During fire detection system testing, Co2 canister triggered remotely and closed the hatches/skylights. Now we cannot open the hatches/skylights due to not having a replacement Co2 canister.

Pilot ladder was found to be rigged to a stanchion which has been damaged at the base. Stanchion was bent and appeared to have been welded several times over with a coat of paint covering possible cracks.

During the operation of the vessel fuelling a ship, a pinhole leak was discovered and operations were stopped, leak was contained. Operation was resumed and clean up of fuel contained in the ship completed. Repairs were carried out and tested.
Crew member reported unsafe workplace practices and conditions, leading to an injury sustained while working on board the vessel.
While exiting vessel, passenger's finger became caught between the seat support and the chair frame, resulting in a fracture.
Departing wharf outbound with tug.  Recreational vessel anchored in the middle of channel.   No response to blasts so had to pass vessel on starboard side.
Whilst vessel was assisting in a rescue, the vessel was caught by a wave and capsized. The individual rescued by a lifeguard and the vessel was returned to shore.
Passenger complaint about operating a water taxi in rough weather and limited access to life jackets.
Whilst conducting a training exercise, the boat was overturned by the wind and swell. Engine failed to start and crew had to paddle the vessel to shore.
A tractor was driving to collect a trailer when the brakes failed and the tractor made contact with a parked Hybrid Marine truck, coming to a stop.
Event Location: In the Port of Auckland at the Fergusson Tunnel car park.

Brief Description: Vessel was reported to be exceeding the speed limit in the harbour with passengers not wearing lifejackets.
Crew member exposed to carbon monoxide emissions reported feeling unwell and was transported to hospital for assessment.
Near miss between and water skier and towing vessel, when another vessel cut between them.
Vessel was conducting a training exercise when a wave picked up quicker than they expected and capsized the vessel. Vessel was towed and reinstated with no damage or injuries.

After testing gear change while on mooring, headed out from harbour but could not change from astern to ahead or neutral.  Unable to anchor in time so drifted onto the rocks.  Was towed off by dinghy with 5hp engine and water taxi assisted.
Jet ski driver was entering the harbour when they hit a sand bar. This caused the driver to be ejected from the vessel, hitting the sand bar and causing injury to their legs.
Recreational vessel overtaken by larger vessel. Wake sent the vessel into a pile marker, resulting in injuries to three passengers.
Crew member fell overboard when IRB hit by wave. No injuries.
During a IRB Crewpersons Course two trainee crewpersons fell out of the boat. Crew retrieved without injury.
Pilot ladder was found to be non-compliant with loose chocks and steps that rotated under foot.

Passenger slipped whilst climbing into the dingy, accidentally causing the engine to engage at full speed, resulting in the passenger to falling overboard and the dingy to careen into a neighbouring boat.
Barge had electrical failure and was taking on water.  Four persons aboard all rescued safely.
Whilst descending a ladder, a crew member twisted their ankle and was assessed by the onboard medical staff before being taken to hospital.

Vessel ran aground and was assessed for damage with none found. Crew of the vessel prepared oil spill kit and radioed for assistance. A vessel assisted and towed them into deeper water and were able to proceed to jetty to do a full inspection.
Event Location: At the Picton side of 'The Snout' point in Queen Charlotte Sound

Brief Description: Portable seat fell onto crew members foot, causing bruising.

Whilst approaching a channel entrance, the engine slowed down so they diverted to another entrance. Engine issue was resolved shortly after and they continued into the alternative entrance as a precautionary measure.
Crew member received injury to their leg when moving equipment.

Master tried to turn to port, but tide was too strong and vessel headed towards dolphin. Master asked the tug to pull, and both engines were put astern. Vessel steered clear of the dolphin, and a second approach was carried out successfully.
Whilst tying up the vessel at the berth, master's finger was caught between the rope and cleat, severing the tip. Master was taken to hospital to receive medical attention.
Pilot ladder and man ropes rigged incorrectly.
Diver reported having observed stevedores throwing bracings and fixings for shipping containers overboard.
Coming into berth, strong wind gust caused vessel to make contact with another berthed vessel.
Student being towed behind jet boat fell off board and ingested some water.
Assessor monitoring asbestos removal communicated that there was an elevated reading near the decontamination unit. Work was stopped, area was cleaned and a barrier was installed.
Cruise ship assisted someone who was in the water after their vessel had sunk.

During training exercise, vessel was running parallel to the beach when a wave doubled up causing an unexpected bounce and both crew fell out of the vessel into waist deep water. Vessel was walked into shore and relaunched after discussion.

Vessel grounded on a sand bank entering a lagoon which developed due to a landslide further up the river. Vessel was secured overnight and pulled off the sand bank via helicopter. Vessel sustained no damage.
Crew person fell out of IRB during training session.
Collision with vessel and jet ski resulting in hospitalization of jet ski rider.
Collision with vessel and jet ski resulting in hospitalization of jet ski rider.
Collision between fishing vessel and yacht.
Ship's bow thruster was working but showing no response on the indicator. Engine was fully operational in backup mode and the vessel departed without incident.
Commercial vessel experienced an unexpected black out. It was found that the coolant circulation pump bearings had failed, which caused the engine to shut down.
Trainee skipper miscontrolled vessel, causing the bow to swing into a pile, resulting in some damage to the pile.
Event Location: Okiato ferry ramp, Okiato, Bay of Islands

Brief Description: Cruise ship captain reported one of five engines was out of action, ship was on route to NZ port.
Fuel tank overflowed and 5-10 litres of marine diesel spilled into harbour.
Jet boat collided with a semi submerged rock and sustained some minor damage. There were no injuries.
Event Location: Dart River - Top section of river (pyramid)

Brief Description: Gyro compass on bulk carrier was showing an error when the pilot boarded. Pilot informed master the gyro must be fully operational prior to departure.
While discharging passengers/ vehicles, #3 D/A tripped causing a temporary blackout until the emergency generator started. The 0200 am / 0745 am return sailings cancelled until power issue resolved.
Hydraulic hose on ship failed resulting in a complete loss of steering
Vessel began tipping due to a shift in weight and began resting on the bottom of the shallow water. Vessel was righted via equipment on the port.

Crane was lifting cargo off container ship when a box became snagged on the box below. The crane operator tried to lower the load but the snagged twistlock broke, sending both boxes towards the walkway.
Event Location: Bay 42 of the MV OOCL Busan.

Brief Description: Ship experienced a power load sharing issue, duty engineers switched the load, and the ship continued on voyage.
Event Location: Voyage from Wellington to Picton. Sinclair head Br 340 x 1.0 miles

Brief Description: Vessel pulled up their anchor to leave and when setting off they noticed the engine stuttering and called for assistance entering port. Once berthed, a commercial diver inspected the vessel and found rope in the propeller and removed it. No damage.
Jetboat flipped on river,. Four people were airlifted to hospital, one with serious injuries
Whilst vessel was conducting a training scenario, a sharp barnacle punctured the vessel. The vessel was able to make it back to be repaired without incident.
Rescue water craft operating during an event was washed up onto rocks. There were no injuries or damage.
Passenger on ferry fell to lower deck when a barrier gave way.
Whilst conducting a training exercise, a person fell overboard and was picked up again, sustaining no injuries.
Minor collision between two vessels. One passenger received a minor abrasion.
Vessel attempted to cross a bar at low tide and without submitting a bar crossing report. Vessel was capsized and injured persons taken to hospital.

Jetboat was on a routine journey when the master noticed a loss of power and smoke coming from one engine. Passengers were transferred onto another vessel and the jetboat was towed back to base. Engine inspected and replaced.
Crew member had a minor medical episode on board vessel.
Event Location: On the kahurangi reef off the west coast of the south Island 8 miles offshore

Brief Description: Straddle struck vessel hatch covers, there was no damage to the covers, the straddle had some damage.
Event Location: At LPC berth CQ East in Lyttelton.

Brief Description: Police removed two occupants from a 52 foot steel yacht that was adrift.
Event Location: Off coast of 99 Mile Beach, Northland (exact location unknown)

Brief Description: Wooden pallets were being loaded onto a vessel via conveyor belt. There was a significant amount of dust coming off the pallets causing multiple work parties to cease work and a fishing vessel further down the port to issue their crew with PPE.
Event Location: Port of Tauranga, Mount Manganui side. Birth 4 - 5.

Brief Description: Pilot ladder was found to be of cheap quality and almost every step was loose and the steps rotated underfoot.
Crew person sustained a leg fracture after IRB hit a large wave.
Passenger of ferry required medical evacuation after sustaining a broken wrist as a result of fall sustained whilst onboard.
Pilot ladder was found to not comply with Maritime Rules and several chocks were loose causing steps to rotate underfoot.
Pilot ladder was found to be in poor condition and of poor quality which appeared stretched with multiple loose chocks.
While approaching berth, vessel hit with the wharf, resulting in noticeable dents on the vessel's left side.
IRB driver was conducting a simulated patient pick up when IRB was struck by a wave, causing the driver to fall overboard.
Event Location: United North Piha (in front of the Club)

Brief Description: Engine failure. The driver stopped the boat in a safe location using the other engine. Passengers were transferred to another boat without incident.
Yacht caught by sudden wind gust, resulting in two people going overboard. Yacht capsized and passengers rescued by RCCNZ. Vessel salvaged by owners.
Motor launch cut close between two sailing vessels causing a blind spot and resulting in an impact/collision between two yachts.
Event Location: No 9 channel marker, cutter channel, Tauranga harbour.

Brief Description: Motor launch cut close between two sailing vessels causing a blind spot and resulting in an impact/collision between two yachts.
Event Location: No 9 channel marker, cutter channel, Tauranga harbour.

Brief Description: Motor launch cut close between two sailing vessels causing a blind spot and resulting in an impact/collision between two yachts.
Event Location: No 9 channel marker, cutter channel, Tauranga harbour.

Brief Description: Vessel dragged anchor and collided with a vessel moored nearby.
Vessel dragged anchor and collided with a vessel moored nearby.
Engineer fell down from the stairs in the engine room, resulting in head injuries.
Skipper of a recreational launch observed a recreational fishing vessel pass closely by and accelerate at speed, causing a wake which almost rolled the launch.
Event Location: Between Kaikoura and Great Barrier Islands

Brief Description: Main engine - unable to increase RPMs when turning into Cutter Channel.
Port employee using a pulling pole to disengage stuck twist lock on container. Hook at the end of the pole slipped off and struck them in the face below left eye and smashed their glasses.
IRB hit large wave and crew member lost footing in the boat and was flung into the air, but landing back in vessel.
Vessel experienced engine failure.  Vessel used second engine to locate to a safe area where passengers transferred to another boat without issue.
Member of crew suffered a medical event on board vessel and was airlifted to hospital for treatment.
Crew member sustained fractured ankles after jumping from bow of boat to the wharf.
Passenger on cruise ship slipped on wet floor and fell on deck, landing on their left wrist, which was later confirmed to be fractured.
Trainee crewperson fell overboard when the vessel hit a wave. There was no damage or injuries.

Vessel was moored when the shackle pin to the mooring came disconnected causing the vessel to drift into the shore. Conditions were very still and vessel was checked via divers and sustained no damage.
Crew member tripped on mooring line and their hard hat made contact with a vent structure. Crew member sustained a cut to the right eyebrow.
During training a rescue vessel capsized after being caught by a wave.
Worker was taking out a mooring line to a bollard when the tension of the rope increased abruptly causing the worker to be knocked over, sustaining an injury to the head.
Event Location: Port of Tauranga - Berth 1 (Wharf Mark 338 approx.)

Brief Description: IRB got side onto the wave and rolled over

Vessel was anchored with a set line between two buoys around 300m away when another vessel pulling a net went between the gap of the vessel and set line. This net caught the set line and then the anchor. The line was cut and the anchor unhooked.
Vessel made contact with a surfer, who suffered a facial graze and minor damage to the surfboard.
After launch of kayak, the master noticed a vessel heading in their direction. Kayak was capsized from the collision and master sustained minor injuries.
After launch of kayak, the master noticed a vessel heading in their direction. Kayak was capsized from the collision and master sustained minor injuries.
Vessel was being inspected for biosecurity risks when the attending vessel came into contact with the boat being inspected due to a gust of wind. Boat sustained minor damage to gel coating.
Vessel was being inspected for biosecurity risks when the attending vessel came into contact with the boat being inspected due to a gust of wind. Boat sustained minor damage to gel coating.
Vessel was attempting to cross a harbour bar when they lost power, causing the vessel to drift into a rougher section and capsize. All passengers returned to shore uninjured
Vessel being towed towards boat ramp made contact with the towing vessel, causing a minor dent.
One of the vessel's engines began to shudder, then lost power. Master idled to the main jetty on the other engine to swap the boat out.

Whilst disembarking the vessel via the pilot ladder, the pilot was about to step over to the pilot boat when the manrope became loose at the deck level causing the pilot to lose balance temporarily and fall into the boat.
Whilst at anchorage, a unit on one of the generators failed, causing the generator to stop.

Vessel was arriving into port when one of the engine's RPM became erratic and required this engine to be shut down. Vessel was in a position to continue berthing with the other engine and assistance from a tug. Issue has been fixed and tested.

Whilst making a routine journey, the vessel experienced a low coolant pressure alarm and engine temperature rose, so engine was shut down. Crew deduced that the water pump failed so returned to harbour under single engine and vessel swapped out.
Event Location: NW of Pine Harbour marina Auckland

Brief Description: Barge came off its stands during high tide and the stern of an adjoining tug came into contact with a rock wall. Divers inspected vessels, no damage.
Whilst boarding the vessel a passenger lost their balance and fell, landing on their arm and causing a fracture.

A series of waves caused the vessel to bounce. Upon landing, one of the crew members was injured and fell overboard. Crew member was retrieved from the water and taken to hospital with a fractured proximal femur.
Vessel was rolling in the sea and the life raft located on the right of the vessel rolled off its cradle. Vessel stopped and begin searching but was unable to locate life raft.
Event Location: NE of AhaAha Rocks, Hauraki Gulf

Brief Description: During departure from port a crew member started to feel dizzy, queasy and unwell. Vessel headed back into port where an ambulance was waiting. Crew member was transported to hospital.
Whilst conducting routine maintenance, a heavy piece of machinery fell on the finger of a crew member. Crew member was taken to hospital to received medical assistance.
Jetski experienced engine issues as a cruise ship was beginning to depart the wharf. Owner attempted to tow vessel causing it to capsize, and throwing its operator into the water.
Jetski experienced engine issues as a cruise ship was beginning to depart the wharf. Owner attempted to tow vessel causing it to capsize, and throwing its operator into the water.
Jetski experienced engine issues as a cruise ship was beginning to depart the wharf. Owner attempted to tow vessel causing it to capsize, and throwing its operator into the water.
During training, IRB got hit by wave and driver got washed overboard.  No injuries, no damage.
Crew member jumped onto oyster line between racks and a nail cut their leg.
Vessel was positioned outside in the sun which caused the pressure inside the tube to increase, splitting the cover.
Pilot ladder was found to be defective, missing a chock on one side. Boarding was delayed and the vessel was instructed to replace the ladder.
The captain refused passenger's request to wear a life jacket when crossing the bar.
During training, crew person fell overboard.  No injuries no damage.
During training - Trainee Crewperson fell out of the IRB. No injuries, IRB circled back around and collected crewperson. Nil injury to members nor damage to equipment.
IRB stalled and while trying to restart engine, both crew washed overboard. Crew climbed back on board and restarted the engine.
During general patrolling - motor stalled and a wave rolled the IRB. No injuries to passengers nor damage to equipment.
During training session a large wave lifted the front of IRB causing it to capsize. Driver sustained a serious leg injury that required surgery.
Event Location: Opotiki Beach, Bay of Plenty (in front of the SLSC)

Brief Description: Crew of recreational vessel were diving displaying the appropriate flag when another vessel began heading towards them. The person onboard attempted to get the attention of the oncoming boat, which ignored their attempts and resulted in a near miss.

Crew of recreational vessel were diving displaying the appropriate flag when another vessel began heading towards them. The person onboard attempted to get the attention of the oncoming boat, which ignored their attempts and resulted in a near miss.
Whilst conducting training exercise, vessel hit a wave and crew member fell out of vessel. No injury.
Team member noticed a dinghy tied to a wharf that was taking on water. Dinghy lifted to safety.

Passenger in cruise ship fell forward upon exiting the elevator and landed on their left side. The next day after visiting the on board medical centre, it was found the passenger had a fractured wrist.
Recreational vessel collided with light pole, causing it to collapse into the water. There was some damage to the vessel so the skipper returned to port.

Crew member was carrying out regular duties when an unknown object came into contact with the crew member's eye. Crew member was seen by onboard medical staff before being medevac'd to hospital to undergo surgery.
Recreational dingy capsized at river mouth and set off their EPIRB. Coastguard responded.
Rescue jet ski grounded whilst undertaking a rescue of kayakers.
Vessel was docked to refuel when the master accidentally knocked the throttle, lurching the vessel forward and causing a puncture to the inflatable tube.
Commercial vessel grounded in foggy conditions. Coastguard attended, and escorted vessel back to berth under it's own power.

Passenger ferry rolled in rough weather causing minor injuries to two passengers and one crew member. Vehicles also moved and were crushed against each other. Course was altered to starboard to move the vessel further from the swell.
Commercial jet boat lost power in one engine, the skipper called base and another boat was sent to transfer passengers onto.
Container ship's forward spring line parted, and the bow came off the wharf due to strong winds. The crew put up additional lines and tightened the other existing lines.
Vessel was traveling under 5 knots close to shore when it made contact with a submerged rock. Vessel sustained small chip on propeller and scrape on outboard skeg.
Event Location: North of Horseshoe Bay, Stewart Island

Brief Description: Vessel was leaving dock when the master noticed vibrations in forward gear and so raised the sails and continued. Engineers report stated shaft was bent or twisted and has been replaced.

Recreational vessel went to the assistance of an injured individual who had fallen down a cliff. A large wave hit the bow, swamping the vessel which then foundered. The vessel's occupants swam to shore.
Notifier reported a small vessel foundered close to a wharf.
Passenger on cruise ship slipped, landing on their side. They were taken to the medical centre where the passenger was found to have fractured their left wrist.
Crew person on rescue craft fell overboard. There were no injuries.
Water ingress in forepeak. Crew activated bilge pump and passengers safely dropped to berth.
Event Location: Between Rangitoto Island and Browns Island

Brief Description: Passenger on cruise ship broke leg after leg buckled underneath them. Passenger was transported to the ship's medical centre and was found to have a fractured femur, the passenger was then disembarked to hospital.

Person anchored and fishing from a recreational vessel, reported a near miss with recreational yacht, the yacht appeared to be on autopilot with someone asleep at the cockpit. The yacht didn't deviate from its course despite hailing.
Rescue driver on a training run accelerated into a wave, which caused the vessel to roll over. There were no injuries.
Skipper of recreational yacht lost steering and the vessel drifted into a moored boat. There was minor damage to the other boat and the owner has been contacted regarding reparation.
Oil tanker discharged a black substance over a 100m area.
